rComments: His lectures are just pure gold. The tests were easy, the readings beautiful. You are going to learn so much. I would give a 10/5 if I could.

He is both an easy grader and extremely vague, so I guess it works out. His lectures, especially in a small class, can get repetitive, and he is a little blunt at times, but I left his class with a solid foundation in Italian culture. Also, you can't skip, especially for seminars: 20% of our grade was on participation/attendance.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Guardiani is an extremely intelligent man who is very eager to share his plethora of knowledge with his students. Unfortunately, he often gets lost in passion and steers off topic. BUT he provides clear test outlines and detailed lectures -- take thorough notes, don't skip class, and you'll get that coveted 4.0.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Clear grading criteria', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: He was a lot more lenient in ITA201 versus ITA200. Still there was a lot of material to cover for both tests. His lectures tend to consist of him rambling more than providing actual information.
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Lectures were all over the place. Gave a cumulated exam review but only put on heavy material from the last few lectures that we didn't focus heavily on. He also added material to the exam that was not on the review. Essay was quite easy and worth a lot so that's the only reason I ended up with a B in his course. If you miss lectures, you'll fail.

Disliked his teaching style. He tells you to review certain aspects for tests and generally those aren't even asked. You need to attend class if not you won't know what you will be tested on. He tends to jump through material. Good lecturer but has unrealistic expectations for his students. Only part I liked about the course was no textbook needed.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Graded by few things', 'Test heavy']

rComments: the worst class i have ever taken at UofT. I hoped for a better foundation when enrolling in this course for my major in bms, but walked out with nothing. His english is non existent, the TA's were useless and barely present and the marking scheme made no sense. Unfortunately, this course is a requirement...but if it wasn't, i wouldve dropped it.

So frustrating. Would alternatively read from the textbook or go off on useless tangents. Assignments were not explained and marks were very hard. I strongly advise anyone who does not require this class to avoid it. A very disappointing experience.

Guardiani is an amazing, intelligent, and friendly professor. I have taken at least 5 courses with him. He is always in his office to help if you need it. He wants to help his students succeed, unlike professors who want to see you fail. Truly my favourite professor.

Wouldn't normally leave a comment except for this was probably them ost useless prof I ever had at UofT. His lectures consisted of reading the text books. I decided to forgo the attendance marks and just do the readings and show up for tests. I did just fine. What a waste of time.

Guardiani means well but this course was a mess. He often rambled and veered off topic. Lecture was mandatory yet it was only him summarizing the readings. I do think I learned a bit from this class but it was in spite of the prof. Class is not too difficult if you learn the key concepts.

I did not like him for Italian or for Media studies. He's very pretentious/self-involved. If you're not Italian, don't bother taking his ITA courses. It's like suicide. Lectures are boring. If this wasn't mandatory for BMS, I would tell you to stay the heck away from this course. Guardiani makes it terrible.
very intelligent and helpful
very handsome and easygoing
Hard to understand (though not his fault), content could be more interesting.
I think this could be the worst class available at u of t. i think it could be an interesting course, but the prof just reads the readings in a confusing way too. a pretty useless class.

First of all, who thinks this guy is hot? He is the WORST prof I've had so far at UofT. I'm sure he's a great Italian prof but for this Media course he truly was terrible. Half the time I had no idea what he was talking about, he blabbered on about nothing. Going into 4th year and this is the only class I have dropped. Speaks for itself.
This guy's one of the best profs in the Italian department at U of T!
This prof's brilliant.  Nice guy, too.
easy going prof
Wonderful professor, very knowledgeable and makes Italian lit very interesting
read the materials, take notes.  simple, no tricks.  interesting info, presentat

ONE OF THE EASIEST COURSES I'VE TAKEN AT UOFT!
